keyMoments.title: Receives Shichibukai Invitation
keyMoments.description: Jinbe receives an invitation from the World Government to become one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, with pardons for all Sun Pirates members.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Jinbe's path as a bridge between humans and fish-men.

keyMoments.title: Accepts Shichibukai Position
keyMoments.description: Jinbe accepts the Shichibukai position to promote peace between humans and fish-men, supporting Queen Otohime's vision.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's commitment to peaceful coexistence over piracy.

keyMoments.title: Fights Arlong
keyMoments.description: Jinbe brutally beats Arlong half-dead with his fists after Arlong denounces him and declares his intention to leave.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jinbe's power and the tragic end of their brotherhood.

reveals.information: Becomes a Shichibukai to promote peace between species
Cannot bring himself to kill Arlong despite their ideological split

relationships.description: Former brothers in the Sun Pirates who split due to ideological differences over how to respond to Fisher Tiger's death.

evolutionMoments.description: Jinbe and Arlong's friendship fractures as Arlong rejects Jinbe's path of peace, leading to a brutal fight.

relationships.description: Jinbe served under Fisher Tiger in the Sun Pirates and inherited leadership after his death.
Jinbe supports Queen Otohime's vision of peaceful coexistence between humans and fish-men.

keyMoments.title: Attempts Revenge on Koala's Village
keyMoments.description: Arlong betrays Fisher Tiger's last wishes and attempts to massacre the villagers who he believes betrayed Tiger.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Arlong's descent into pure hatred and rejection of Tiger's philosophy.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Borsalino
keyMoments.description: Vice-Admiral Borsalino easily defeats Arlong when he attempts to attack Koala's village.
keyMoments.significance: Prevents Arlong from committing mass murder and leads to his capture.

keyMoments.title: Lies About Fisher Tiger's Death
keyMoments.description: During interrogation, Arlong lies to the Marines, claiming humans killed Tiger by refusing a blood transfusion, omitting that Tiger refused human blood.
keyMoments.significance: Arlong manipulates the narrative to protect Tiger's honor while fueling anti-human propaganda.
keyMoments.quote: The humans refused to give Fisher Tiger a blood transfusion and let him die!

keyMoments.title: Leaves the Sun Pirates
keyMoments.description: Arlong denounces Jinbe as a 'government dog' and declares his intention to form the Arlong Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Arlong's independent reign of terror that will lead him to the East Blue.
keyMoments.quote: I will become the rage of Fish-Men!

reveals.information: Was captured and imprisoned after trying to attack Koala's village following Fisher Tiger's death
Rejects any path of coexistence with humans, viewing them as inferior and deserving of revenge

relationships.description: Former brothers in the Sun Pirates who become enemies due to opposing views on humans.

evolutionMoments.description: Arlong denounces Jinbe and they fight, ending their friendship.

relationships.description: Arlong served under Fisher Tiger but rejects his philosophy after his death.

keyMoments.title: Receives News of Fisher Tiger's Death
keyMoments.description: Otohime receives Jinbe's letter informing her of Fisher Tiger's death.
keyMoments.significance: Tiger's death impacts her peace campaign negatively.

keyMoments.title: Petition Signatures Withdrawn
keyMoments.description: Many citizens withdraw their signatures from her petition following Fisher Tiger's death, citing inability to trust humans.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how fragile progress toward peace can be in the face of tragedy.
keyMoments.quote: There are 5 million people on the island and I only have 1,000 signatures, but I still have a long way to go.

keyMoments.title: Drunken Broadcast
keyMoments.description: In despair, Otohime broadcasts a drunken, passionate rant about her ambitions to the entire island.
keyMoments.significance: Her raw emotion begins to reach some hearts despite the setback.

reveals.information: Faces major setbacks in her peace campaign, losing hard-won petition signatures

relationships.description: King Neptune's wife and queen of Fish-Man Island.
Jinbe supports Otohime's vision of peaceful coexistence.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Arlong as Vice-Admiral
keyMoments.description: As a Vice-Admiral, Borsalino easily defeats Arlong when he attempts to attack Koala's village.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Borsalino's power before he became an Admiral (Kizaru).

reveals.information: Appears in flashback as a Vice-Admiral, before his promotion to Admiral
